forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Clear, with a low around 49. Northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 57 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 3 to 10 mph.

weather_report:
As the tranquil night wraps its arms around Downtown San Francisco, a serene clarity blankets the city. Temperatures dipped comfortably to the low 50s, where a gentle northwest breeze rustles through the trees, whispering of the clear skies to come. The dawn heralds a fine Tuesday ahead, teasing the city with bright sunshine that promises to lift the spirits of all who wander its streets. The day will warm to a mild 60, coaxing a gradual melting of any remnants of chill left from the night.

The forecast holds no hint of fog, leaving the horizon unobstructed and the iconic silhouette of the Golden Gate Bridge poised prominently against the azure expanse. With the absence of the usual marine layer, the day invites exploration, whether it be a leisurely stroll along the Embarcadero or perhaps a quiet moment savoring rich coffee at a sun-drenched café. As the sun’s rays begin to paint the landscape, layering a light sweater beneath a jacket would be wise, making it easy to adapt to the slight afternoon coolness. Such is the charm of a San Francisco day in November, where the city’s beauty beckons quietly, urging one to pause, breathe, and bask in the simple delight of the moment.
